Configuring Network Control Policy

The Network Control Policy goal is to check the network control settings for the Cisco UCS ADA domain.

 1. In the Network Control Policy screen, enter a name for network control policy in the Name field.

Figure 5-4 Network Control Policy

 2. From the Organization drop-down list, select the required organization for which you wish to configure the network control policy.

 3. Enter the Name of Network Control Policy

 4. From the CDP field, define the Cisco Discovery Protocol. The values are enabled and disabled. Select the value depending on the servers associated to a profile.

 5. From the MAC Register Mode drop-down list, verify if the adapters are associated to a native LAN or to all host LANs that are connected to a network. The values are Only Native Vlan and All Host Vlans.

 6. From the Action on Uplink Fail drop-down list, select the option that is required. The values are Link Down and Warning. Selecting the option Warning enables you to notify with a warning message, and the uplink connectivity does not fail. The link down option notifies that the connectivity fails.

 7. From the MAC Security drop-down list, select the value Allow or deny.

 8. Click Add to configure the Network Control Policy.

The derived network control policy information is displayed in the text area.

 9. Click Save and Next to proceed further.
